meanings.definition: Not curious or inquisitive; showing a lack of interest or curiosity.
meanings.sent1: The incurious cat lounged in the sun, uninterested in the birds chirping nearby.
meanings.sent2: She was so incurious about the new book that she didn't even bother to read the first page.
meanings.sent3: The incurious student yawned loudly during the fascinating science experiment.
meanings.sent4: His incurious nature made him blind to the beauty of the world around him.
meanings.sent5: The incurious child missed out on so many exciting adventures due to his lack of interest.

meanings.definition: Not eager to learn or explore; indifferent or uninterested.
meanings.sent1: The incurious puppy stayed in its bed, uninterested in the noisy toys around it.
meanings.sent2: She had an incurious attitude towards history class, rarely participating in discussions.
meanings.sent3: The incurious explorer decided to stay in the camp instead of venturing into the unknown forest.
meanings.sent4: His incurious demeanor towards art left him unaffected by the vibrant paintings in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The incurious traveler missed the chance to discover hidden gems in the small town.
